flawed_nl_solution:
If Masud has 60 siblings, and Carlos has 3/4 times as many siblings as Masud, Carlos has 3/4*60=<<60*3/4=240/3>>240/3 siblings.
Four times as many siblings as Masud has is 4*60=<<4*60=240>>240
Janet has 60 less than four times as many siblings as Masud, a total of 240-60=<<240-60=180>>180 siblings.
The number of siblings Janet have more than Carlos is 180-240/3=<<180-240/3=100>>100
#### 100

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 45, not 240/3. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
